metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15671 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The glob function in glob.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6)before 2.27, when invoked with GLOB_TILDE, could skip freeing allocatedmemory when processing the ~ operator with a long user name, potentiallyleading to a denial of service (memory leak).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.23-0ubuntu11
libc-bin - 2.23-0ubuntu11
libc6 - 2.23-0ubuntu11
libc6-amd64 - 2.23-0ubuntu11
libc6-armel - 2.23-0ubuntu11
libc6-i386 - 2.23-0ubuntu11
libc6-pic - 2.23-0ubuntu11
libc6-s390 - 2.23-0ubuntu11
libc6-x32 - 2.23-0ubuntu11
locales - 2.23-0ubuntu11
locales-all - 2.23-0ubuntu11
multiarch-support - 2.23-0ubuntu11
nscd - 2.23-0ubuntu11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glibc package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.23-0ubuntu11').
